text: We will hear arguments next in 1914, Monell against City of New York.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the court.
Do you say monitory relief is sought against them in their official capacity, you mean monitory relief to come out of the public treasury in some form?
That would be the effect of it, yes.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the court.
Counsel, this morning I do not know if you sat here during the argument in the Memphis.
Under the city charter apparently it is set up that way.
And the mayor ran that like he did other divisions.
The mayor appoints two members of the board I believe Your Honor and the bar presidents, I think each appoint one member.
But they do not themselves have taxing authority.
